fastcsv

Class CsvRow

  • java.lang.Object
    • fastcsv.CsvRow

  • public final class CsvRow
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a single CSV row.

    Oliver Siegmar

      • getField

        public java.lang.String getField(int index)
        Gets a field value by its index (starting with 0).
        Parameters:
        index - index of the field to return
        Returns:
        field value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range

      • getField

        public java.lang.String getField(java.lang.String name)
        Gets a field value by its name.
        Parameters:
        name - field name
        Returns:
        field value, null if this row has no such field
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if CSV is read without headers - see CsvReader.containsHeader

      • getFieldCount

        public int getFieldCount()
        Gets the number of fields of this row.
        Returns:
        the number of fields of this row

      • getFieldMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getFieldMap()
        Gets an unmodifiable map of header names and field values of this row. The map will always contain all header names - even if their value is null.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable map of header names and field values of this row
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if CSV is read without headers - see CsvReader.containsHeader

      • getFields

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getFields()
        Gets all fields of this row as an unmodifiable List.
        Returns:
        all fields of this row

      • getOriginalLineNumber

        public long getOriginalLineNumber()
        Returns the original line number (starting with 1). On multi-line rows this is the starting line number. Empty lines could be skipped via CsvReader.setSkipEmptyRows(boolean).
        Returns:
        the original line number

        public java.lang.String toString()
